body_html:
@carlorosati Since C++11 it is defined in the std namespace via the header <cfenv>.

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/fenv/feround

Can we change the code to use that header instead and get rid of the direct references to
__STDC_IEC_559__? If not, I'm OK with your change.
body_text:
@carlorosati Since C++11 it is defined in the std namespace via the header <cfenv>.
http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/fenv/feround
Can we change the code to use that header instead and get rid of the direct references to
__STDC_IEC_559__? If not, I'm OK with your change.
body:
@carlorosati Since C++11 it is defined in the std namespace via the header \<cfenv\>.

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/fenv/feround

Can we change the code to use that header instead and get rid of the direct references to 
\_\_STDC_IEC_559__? If not, I'm OK with your change.
